p: In 2006 to 2010, age-standardised HIV diagnosis rates attributed to heterosexual contact were significantly higher in men born in North-West Europe (IRR 1.65, 95% CI 1.20–2.26), North Africa and the Middle East (IRR 3.69, 95% CI 2.37–5.73), South-East Asia (IRR 5.19, 95% CI 3.86–6.96), Southern and Central Asia (IRR 3.55, 95% CI 2.42–5.20), the Americas (IRR 2.35, 95% 1.21–4.56) and Sub-Saharan Africa (IRR 28.82, 95% 23.31–35.64) compared to Australian-born men. Rates were lower or not significantly different for men born in Southern and Eastern Europe, North-East Asia or Oceania compared with men born in Australia.
